spells: The alhoon's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 16). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
The alhoon is a 12th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). The alhoon has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): chill touch, dancing lights, mage hand, prestidigitation, shocking grasp

spells.1st level (4 slots): detect magic, disguise self, magic missile, shield

spells.4th level (3 slots): confusion, Evard's black tentacles, phantasmal killer

monsters.name: Annis Hag
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The annis makes three attacks: one with her bite and two with her claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 15 (3d6 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 15 (3d6 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Crushing Hug
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 36 (9d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 15) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the target takes 36 (9d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the hag's turns. The hag can't make attacks while grappling a creature in this way.

spells: The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 13). She can innately cast the following spells:

monsters.name: Apprentice Wizard

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

spells: The apprentice is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, mending, prestidigitation

monsters.name: Archdruid

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Change Shape (2/Day)
actions.desc:
The archdruid magically polymorphs into a beast or elemental with a challenge rating of 6 or less, and can remain in this form for up to 9 hours. The archdruid can choose whether its equipment falls to the ground, melds with its new form, or is worn by the new form. The archdruid reverts to its true form if it dies or falls unconscious. The archdruid can revert to its true form using a bonus action on its turn.
While in a new form, the archdruid retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, and Dexterity are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any special senses, proficiencies, traits, actions, and reactions (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks. It can cast its spells with verbal or somatic components in its new form.
The new form's attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances and immunity to nonmagical attacks.

spells: The archdruid is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, mending, poison spray, produce flame

spells.1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, entangle, faerie fire, speak with animals

spells.2nd level (3 slots): animal messenger, beast sense, hold person

spells.3rd level (3 slots): conjure animals, meld into stone, water breathing

spells.4th level (3 slots): dominate beast, locate creature, stoneskin, wall of fire

spells.5th level (3 slots): commune with nature, mass cure wounds, tree stride

traits.name: Archer's Eye (3/Day)
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the archer can add 1d10 to its next attack or damage roll with a longbow or shortbow.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The archer makes two attacks with its longbow.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the aurochs moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Babau
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The babau makes two melee attacks. It can also use Weakening Gaze before or after making these attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage when used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Weakening Gaze
actions.desc: The babau targets one creature that it can see within 20 feet of it. The target must make a 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The babau's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 11). The babau can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: darkness, dispel magic, fear, heat metal, levitate

monsters.name: Banderhobb
monsters.languages: Common and the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Resonant Connection
traits.desc: If the banderhobb has even a tiny piece of a creature or an object in its possession, such as a lock of hair or a splinter of wood, it knows the most direct route to that creature or object if it is within 1 mile of the banderhobb.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the banderhobb can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 22 (5d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 15) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the banderhobb can't use its bite attack or tongue attack on another target.

actions.name: Tongue
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 10 (3d6) necrotic damage, and the target must make a 15 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled to a space within 5 feet of the banderhobb, which can use a bonus action to make a bite attack against the target.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.desc:
The banderhobb makes a bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the banderhobb and it takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage at the start of each of the banderhobb's turns. A creature reduced to 0 hit points in this way stops taking necrotic damage and becomes stable.
The banderhobb can have only one target swallowed at a time. While the banderhobb isn't incapacitated, it can regurgitate the creature at any time (no action required) in a space within 5 feet of it. The creature exits prone. If the banderhobb dies, it likewise regurgitates a swallowed creature.

actions.name: Shadow Step
actions.desc: The banderhobb magically teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space of dim light or darkness that it can see. Before or after teleporting, it can make a bite or tongue attack.

monsters.name: Bard

traits.name: Song of Rest
traits.desc: The bard can perform a song while taking a short rest. Any ally who hears the song regains an extra 1d6 hit points if it spends any Hit Dice to regain hit points at the end of that rest. The bard can confer this benefit on itself as well.

traits.name: Taunt (2/Day)
traits.desc: The bard can use a bonus action on its turn to target one creature within 30 feet of it. If the target can hear the bard, the target must succeed on a 12 Charisma saving throw or have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the start of the bard's next turn.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

spells: The bard is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following bard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): friends, mage hand, vicious mockery

spells.1st level (4 slots): charm person, healing word, heroism, sleep, thunderwave

monsters.name: Barghest
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 15
monsters.languages: Abyssal, Common, Goblin, Infernal, telepathy 60 ft.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The barghest can use its action to polymorph into a Small goblin or back into its true form. Other than its size and speed, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. The barghest reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Fire Banishment
traits.desc: When the barghest starts its turn engulfed in flames that are at least 10 feet high or wide, it must succeed on a 15 Charisma saving throw or be instantly banished to Gehenna. Instantaneous bursts of flame (such as a red dragon's breath or a fireball spell) don't have this effect on the barghest.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The barghest has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Soul Feeding
traits.desc:
A barghest can feed on the corpse of a humanoid that it killed that has been dead for less than 10 minutes, devouring both flesh and soul in doing so. This feeding takes at least 1 minute, and it destroys the victim's body. The victim's soul is trapped in the barghest for 24 hours, after which time it is digested. If the barghest dies before the soul is digested, the soul is released.
While a humanoid's soul is trapped in a barghest, any form of revival that could work has only a {@chance 50|50 percent} chance of doing so, freeing the soul from the barghest if it is successful. Once a creature's soul is digested, however, no mortal magic can return that humanoid to life.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

spells: The barghest's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 12). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: levitate, minor illusion, pass without trace

monsters.name: Bheur Hag

traits.name: Graystaff Magic
traits.desc: The hag carries a graystaff, a length of gray wood that is a focus for her inner power. She can ride the staff as if it were a broom of flying. While holding the staff, she can cast additional spells with her Innate Spellcasting trait (these spells are marked with an asterisk). If the staff is lost or destroyed, the hag must craft another, which takes a year and a day. Only a bheur hag can use a graystaff.

traits.name: Ice Walk
traits.desc: The hag can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost her extra moment.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Maddening Feast
actions.desc: The hag feasts on the corpse of one enemy within 5 feet of her that died within the past minute. Each creature of the hag's choice that is within 60 feet of her and able to see her must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of her for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, a creature is incapacitated, can't understand what others say, can't read, and speaks only in gibberish; the DM controls the creature's movement, which is erratic. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Maddening Feast for the next 24 hours.

spells: The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.Daily (3e): cone of cold*, ice storm*, wall of ice*

monsters.name: Black Guard Drake
monsters.damage_resistances: acid
monsters.languages: understands Draconic but can't speak it

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The guard drake can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drake attacks twice, once with its bite and once with its tail.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Blackguard
monsters.alignment: lawful neutral (law/chaos axis) chaotic neutral (good/evil axis) evil

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The blackguard makes three attacks with its glaive or its shortbow.

actions.name: Glaive
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +3 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Dreadful Aspect (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The blackguard exudes magical menace. Each enemy within 30 feet of the blackguard must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. If a frightened target ends its turn more than 30 feet away from the blackguard, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The blackguard is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

spells.1st level (4 slots): command, protection from evil and good, thunderous smite

monsters.name: Blue Guard Drake
monsters.damage_resistances: lightning
monsters.languages: understands Draconic but can't speak it

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drake attacks twice, once with its bite and once with its tail.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Bodak
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.languages: Abyssal, the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Aura of Annihilation
traits.desc: The bodak can activate or deactivate this feature as a bonus action. While active, the aura deals 5 necrotic damage to any creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of the bodak. Undead and fiends ignore this effect.

traits.name: Death Gaze
traits.desc:
When a creature that can see the bodak's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the bodak, the bodak can force it to make a 13 Constitution saving throw if the bodak isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is reduced to 0 hit points, unless it is immune to the frightened condition. Otherwise, a creature takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage on a failed save.
Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the bodak until the start of its next turn. If the creature looks at the bodak in the meantime, it must immediately make the saving throw.

traits.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
traits.desc: The bodak takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Withering Gaze
actions.desc: One creature that the bodak can see within 60 feet of it must make a 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Boggle
monsters.damage_resistances: fire

traits.name: Boggle Oil
traits.desc:
The boggle excretes nonflammable oil from its pores. The boggle chooses whether the oil is slippery or sticky and can change the oil on its skin from one consistency to another as a bonus action.
Slippery Oil: While coated in slippery oil, the boggle gains advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks made to escape bonds, squeeze through narrow spaces, and end grapples.
Sticky Oil: While coated in sticky oil, the boggle gains advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to grapple and any ability check made to maintain a hold on another creature, a surface, or an object. The boggle can also climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Dimensional Rift
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the boggle can create an invisible and immobile rift within an opening or frame it can see within 5 feet of it, provided that the space is no bigger than 10 feet on any side. The dimensional rift bridges the distance between that space and any point within 30 feet of it that the boggle can see or specify by distance and direction (such as "30 feet straight up"). While next to the rift, the boggle can see through it and is considered to be next to the destination as well, and anything the boggle puts through the rift (including a portion of its body) emerges at the destination. Only the boggle can use the rift, and it lasts until the end of the boggle's next turn.

traits.name: Uncanny Smell
traits.desc: The boggle has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

actions.name: Pummel
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Oil Puddle
actions.desc:
The boggle creates a puddle of oil that is either slippery or sticky (boggle's choice). The puddle is 1 inch deep and covers the ground in the boggle's space. The puddle is difficult terrain For all creatures except boggles and lasts for 1 hour.
If the oil is slippery, any creature that enters the puddle's area or starts its turn there must succeed on a 11 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.
If the oil is sticky, any creature that enters the puddle's area or starts its turn there must succeed on a 11 Strength saving throw or be restrained. On its turn. a creature can use an action to try to extricate itself from the sticky puddle, ending the effect and moving into the nearest safe unoccupied space with a successful 11 Strength check.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 27 (5d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 32 (6d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The catoblepas has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Stench
traits.desc: Any creature other than a catoblepas that starts its turn within 10 feet of the catoblepas must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of any catoblepas for 1 hour.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 21 (5d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the start of the catoblepas's next turn.

actions.name: Death Ray (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The catoblepas targets a creature that it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target instead takes 64 necrotic damage. The target dies if reduced to 0 hit points by this ray.

traits.name: Adhesive Filament
traits.desc: The cave fisher can use its action to extend a sticky filament up to 60 feet, and the filament adheres to anything that touches it. A creature adhered to the filament is grappled by the cave fisher (escape 13), and ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage. The filament can be attacked (AC 15; 5 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage), but a weapon that fails to sever it becomes stuck to it, requiring an action and a successful 13 Strength check to pull free. Destroying the filament causes no damage to the cave fisher, which can extrude a replacement filament on its next turn

traits.name: Flammable Blood
traits.desc: If the cave fisher drops to half its hit points or fewer, it gains vulnerability to fire damage.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The cave fisher can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cave fisher makes two attacks with its claws.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Filament
actions.desc: One creature grappled by the cave fisher's adhesive filament must make a 13 Strength saving throw, provided that the target weighs 200 pounds or less. On a failure, the target is pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the cave fisher, and the cave fisher makes a claw attack against it as a bonus action. Reeling up the target releases anyone else who was attached to the filament. Until the grapple ends on the target, the cave fisher can't extrude another filament.

traits.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
traits.desc: The champion rerolls a failed saving throw.

traits.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the champion can regain 20 hit points.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The champion makes three attacks with its greatsword or its shortbow.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage, plus 7 (2d6) slashing damage if the champion has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, plus 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the champion has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The chitine has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the chitine to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the chitine has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.desc: While in contact with a web, the chitine knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.desc: The chitine ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The chitine makes three attacks with its daggers.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Choldrith

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The choldrith has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the choldrith to sleep.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The choldrith can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the choldrith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.desc: While in contact with a web, the choldrith knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.desc: The choldrith ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Web (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one Large or smaller creature. The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a 11 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; 5 hit points; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

spells: The choldrith is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The choldrith has the following cleric spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): guidance, mending, resistance, thaumaturgy

spells.1st level (4 slots): bane, healing word, sanctuary, shield of faith

monsters.name: Cloud Giant Smiling One

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The giant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes two attacks with its morningstar.

actions.name: Morningstar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 21 (3d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage. The attack deals an extra 14 (4d6) damage if the giant has advantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +12 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage. The attack deals an extra 14 (4d6) damage if the giant has advantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.desc: The giant magically polymorphs into a beast or humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Any equipment the giant is wearing or carrying is absorbed by the new form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

spells: The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.Daily (3e): feather fall, fly, misty step, telekinesis

spells: The giant is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The giant has the following bard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): minor illusion, prestidigitation, vicious mockery

spells.1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, disguise self, silent image, Tasha's hideous laughter

monsters.name: Conjurer

traits.name: Benign Transportation (Recharges after the Conjurer Casts a Conjuration Spell of 1st Level or Higher)
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the conjurer teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that it can see. If it instead chooses a space within range that is occupied by a willing Small or Medium creature, they both teleport, swapping places.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

spells: The conjurer is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is intelligence (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The conjurer has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): acid splash, mage hand, poison spray, prestidigitation

spells.1st level (4 slots): mage armor, magic missile, unseen servant*

spells.2nd level (3 slots): cloud of daggers*, misty step*, web*

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the cow moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

traits.name: Illumination
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the cranium rat can shed dim light from its brain in a 5-foot radius or extinguish the light.

traits.name: Telepathic Shroud
traits.desc: The cranium rat is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as to all divination spells.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage.

monsters.name: Darkling
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 15

traits.name: Death Flash
traits.desc: When the darkling dies, nonmagical light flashes out from it in a 10-foot radius as its body and possessions, other than metal or magic objects, burn to ash. Any creature in that area and able to see the bright light must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the creature's next turn.

traits.name: Light Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in bright light, the darkling has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage. If the darkling has advantage on the attack roll, the attack deals an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Darkling Elder
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 16

traits.name: Death Burn
traits.desc: When the darkling elder dies, magical light flashes out from it in a 10-foot radius as its body and possessions, other than metal or magic objects, burn to ash. Any creature in that area must make a 11 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 7 (2d6) radiant damage and, if the creature can see the light, is blinded until the end of its next turn. If the saving throw is successful, the creature takes half the damage and isn't blinded.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The darkling elder makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the darkling elder had advantage on the attack roll, the attack deals as: extra 10 (3d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Darkness (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The darkling elder casts darkness without any components. Wisdom is its spellcasting ability.

traits.name: Lightning Blood
traits.desc: A creature within 5 feet of the death kiss takes 5 (1d10) lightning damage whenever it hits the death kiss with a melee attack that deals piercing or slashing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The death kiss makes three tentacle attacks. Up to three of these attacks can be replaced by Blood Drain, one replacement per tentacle grappling a creature

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 14 (3d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 14) if it is a Huge or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the death kiss can't use the same tentacle on another target. The death kiss has ten tentacles.

actions.name: Blood Drain
actions.desc: One creature grappled by a tentacle of the death kiss must make a 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 22 (4d10) lightning damage, and the death kiss regains half as many hit points.

monsters.name: Deep Rothé

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the rothé moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

spells: The deep rothé's spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast dancing lights at will, requiring no components.

monsters.name: Deep Scion
monsters.speed: 30 ft. (20 ft. and swim 40 ft. in hybrid form)

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The deep scion can use its action to polymorph into a humanoid-piscine hybrid form, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. The deep scion reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Amphibious (Hybrid Form Only)
traits.desc: The deep scion can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: In humanoid form, the deep scion makes two melee attacks. In hybrid form, the deep scion makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Battleaxe (Humanoid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Bite (Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw (Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Psychic Screech (Hybrid Form Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The deep scion emits a terrible scream audible within 300 feet. Creatures within 30 feet of the deep scion must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the end of the deep scion's next turn. In water, the psychic screech also telepathically transmits the deep scion's memories of the last 24 hours to its master, regardless of distance, so long as it and its master are in the same body of water.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.desc: If the deinonychus moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the deinonychus can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The deinonychus makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Devourer
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The devourer makes two claw attacks and can use either Imprison Soul or Soul Rend.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Imprison Soul
actions.desc: The devourer chooses a living humanoid with 0 hit points that it can see within 30 feet of it. That creature is teleported inside the devourer's ribcage and imprisoned there. A creature imprisoned in this manner has disadvantage on death saving throws. If it dies while imprisoned, the devourer regains 25 hit points, immediately recharges Soul Rend, and gains an additional action on its next turn. Additionally, at the start of its next turn, the devourer regurgitates the slain creature as a bonus action, and the creature becomes an undead. If the victim had 2 or fewer Hit Dice, it becomes a zombie. if it had 3 to 5 Hit Dice, it becomes a ghoul. Otherwise, it becomes a wight. A devourer can imprison only one creature at a time.

actions.name: Soul Rend (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The devourer creates a vortex of life-draining energy in a 20-foot radius centered on itself. Each humanoid in that area must make a 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Increase the damage by 10 for each living humanoid with 0 hit points in that area.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Diviner

traits.name: Portent (Recharges after the Diviner Casts a Divination Spell of 1st Level or Higher)
traits.desc: When the diviner or a creature it can see makes an attack roll, a saving throw, or an ability check, the diviner can roll a d20 and choose to use this roll in place of the attack roll, saving throw, or ability check.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d8 - 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

spells: The diviner is a 15th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The diviner has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, message, true strike

spells.1st level (4 slots): detect magic*, feather fall, mage armor

spells.2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts*, locate object*, scorching ray

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the dolphin moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a slam attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The dolphin can hold its breath for 20 minutes.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Draegloth
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The draegloth has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The draegloth makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 16 (2d10 + 5) slashing damage.

spells: The draegloth's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 11). The draegloth can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Elder Brain
monsters.languages: understands Common, Deep Speech, and Undercommon but can't speak, telepathy 5 miles

traits.name: Creature Sense
traits.desc: The elder brain is aware of the presence of creatures within 5 miles of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each one's intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the elder brain fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The elder brain has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Telepathic Hub
traits.desc: The elder brain can use its telepathy to initiate and maintain telepathic conversations with up to ten creatures at a time. The elder brain can let those creatures telepathically hear each other while connected in this way.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. 20 (4d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 15) and takes 9 (1d8 + 5) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the grapple ends. The elder brain can have up to four targets grappled at a time.

actions.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The elder brain magically emits psychic energy. Creatures of the elder brain's choice within 60 feet of it must succeed on a 18 Intelligence saving throw or take 32 (5d10 + 5) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Psychic Link
actions.desc: The elder brain targets one incapacitated creature it can perceive with its Creature Sense trait and establishes a psychic link with that creature. Until the psychic link ends, the elder brain can perceive everything the target senses. The target becomes aware that something is linked to its mind once it is no longer incapacitated, and the elder brain can terminate the link at any time (no action required). The target can use an action on its turn to attempt to break the psychic link, doing so with a successful 18 Charisma saving throw. On a successful save, the target takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage. The psychic link also ends if the target and the elder brain are more than 5 miles apart, with no consequences to the target. The elder brain can form psychic links with up to ten creatures at a time.

actions.name: Sense Thoughts
actions.desc: The elder brain targets a creature with which it has a psychic link. The elder brain gains insight into the target's reasoning, its emotional state, and thoughts that loom large in its mind (including things the target worries about, loves, or hates). The elder brain can also make a Charisma (Deception) check with advantage to deceive the target's mind into thinking it believes one idea or feels a particular emotion. The target contests this attempt with a Wisdom (Insight) check. If the elder brain succeeds, the mind believes the deception for 1 hour or until evidence of the lie is presented to the target.

legendary_actions.name: Tentacle
legendary_actions.desc: The elder brain makes a tentacle attack.

legendary_actions.name: Break Concentration
legendary_actions.desc: The elder brain targets a creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. The elder brain breaks the creature's concentration on a spell it has cast. The creature also takes 1d4 psychic damage per level of the spell.

legendary_actions.name: Psychic Pulse
legendary_actions.desc: The elder brain targets a creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. Enemies of the elder brain within 10 feet of that creature take 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

legendary_actions.name: Sever Psychic Link
legendary_actions.desc: The elder brain targets a creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. The elder brain ends the link, causing the creature to have disadvantage on all ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of the creature's next turn.

spells: The elder brain's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 18). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

monsters.name: Enchanter

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d8 - 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

reactions.name: Instinctive Charm (Recharges after the Enchanter Casts an Enchantment Spell of 1st level or Higher)
reactions.desc:
The enchanter tries to magically divert an attack made against it, provided that the attacker is within 30 feet of it and visible to it. The enchanter must decide to do so before the attack hits or misses.
The attacker must make a 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker targets the creature closest to it, other than the enchanter or itself. If multiple creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target.

spells: The enchanter is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The enchanter has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): friends, mage hand, mending, message

spells.1st level (4 slots): charm person*, mage armor, magic missile

monsters.name: Evoker

traits.name: Sculpt Spells
traits.desc: When the evoker casts an evocation spell that forces other creatures it can see to make a saving throw, it can choose a number of them equal to 1 + the spell's level. These creatures automatically succeed on their saving throws against the spell. If a successful save means a chosen creature would take half damage from the spell, it instead takes no damage from it.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d8 - 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

spells: The evoker is a 12th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The evoker has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): fire bolt*, light*, prestidigitation, ray of frost*

spells.1st level (4 slots): burning hands*, mage armor, magic missile*

traits.name: Dual Shields
traits.desc: The giant carries two shields, each of which is accounted for in the giant's AC. The giant must stow or drop one of its shields to hurl rocks.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes two fireshield attacks.

actions.name: Fireshield
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 22 (4d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage plus 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +13 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Shield Charge
actions.desc: The giant moves up to 30 feet in a straight line and can move through the space of any creature smaller than Huge. The first time it enters a creature's space during this move, it makes a fireshield attack against that creature. If the attack hits, the target must also succeed on a 21 Strength saving throw or be pushed ahead of the giant for the rest of this move. If a creature fails the save by 5 or more, it is also knocked prone and takes 18 (3d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage, or 29 (6d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage if it was already prone.

monsters.name: Firenewt Warlock of Imix
monsters.senses: darkvision 120 ft. (penetrates magical darkness), passive Perception 10

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The firenewt can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Imix's Blessing
traits.desc: When the firenewt reduces an enemy to 0 hit points, the firenewt gains 5 temporary hit points.

actions.name: Morningstar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

spells: The firenewt's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast mage armor (self only) at will, requiring no material components.

The firenewt is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

spells.Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, guidance, light, mage hand, prestidigitation

spells.2nd level (2 slots): burning hands, flaming sphere, hellish rebuke, scorching ray

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The firenewt can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The firenewt makes two attacks with its scimitar.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage.

actions.name: Spit Fire (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The firenewt spits fire at a creature within 10 feet of it. The creature must make a 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 (2d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one

monsters.name: Flail Snail
monsters.senses: darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 10

traits.name: Antimagic Shell
traits.desc: The snail has advantage on saving throws against spells, and any creature making a spell attack against the snail has disadvantage on the attack roll. If the snail succeeds on its saving throw against a spell or a spell attack misses it, an additional effect might occur, as determined by rolling a d6:

If the spell affects an area or has multiple targets, it fails and has no effect. If the spell targets only the snail, it has no effect on the snail and is reflected back at the caster, using the spell slot level, spell save DC, attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the caster.
No additional effect.

The snail's shell converts some of the spell's energy into a burst of destructive force. Each creature within 30 feet of the snail must make a 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 1d6 force damage per level of the spell on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Flail Tentacles
traits.desc: The flail snail has five flail tentacles. Whenever the snail takes 10 damage or more on a single turn, one of its tentacles dies. If even one tentacle remains, the snail regrows all dead ones within 1d4 days. If all its tentacles die, the snail retracts into its shell, gaining total cover, and it begins wailing, a sound that can be heard for 600 feet, stopping only when it dies 5d6 minutes later. Healing magic that restores limbs, such as the regenerate spell, can halt this dying process.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The flail snail makes as many flail tentacle attacks as it has flail tentacles, all against the same target.

actions.name: Flail Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Scintillating Shell (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The snail's shell emits dazzling, colored light until the end of the snail's next turn. During this time, the shell sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet, and creatures that can see the snail have disadvantage on attack rolls against it. In addition, any creature within the bright light and able to see the snail when this power is activated must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the light ends.

actions.name: Shell Defense
actions.desc: The flail snail withdraws into its shell, gaining a +4 bonus to AC until it emerges. It can emerge from its shell as a bonus action on its turn.

traits.name: Aura of Blood Thirst
traits.desc: If the flind isn't incapacitated, any creature with the Rampage trait can make a bite attack as a bonus action while within 10 feet of the flind.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The flind makes three attacks: one with each of its different flail attacks or three with its longbow.

actions.name: Flail of Madness
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target must make a 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target must make a melee attack against a random target within its reach on its next turn. If it has no targets within its reach even after moving, it loses its action on that turn.

actions.name: Flail of Pain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 22 (4d10) psychic damage.

actions.name: Flail of Paralysis
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 4 (1d8) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Froghemoth
monsters.damage_resistances: fire, lightning

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The froghemoth can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Shock Susceptibility
traits.desc: If the froghemoth takes lightning damage, it suffers several effects until the end of its next turn: its speed is halved, it takes a −2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, it can't use reactions or Multiattack, and on its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The froghemoth makes two attacks with its tentacles. It can also use its tongue or bite.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 16) if it is a Huge or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the froghemoth can't use this tentacle on another target. The froghemoth has four tentacles.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage, and the target is swallowed if it is a Medium or smaller creature. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the froghemoth, and takes 10 (3d6) acid damage at the start of each of the froghemoth's turns.
The froghemoth's gullet can hold up to two creatures at a time. If the Froghemoth takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the Froghemoth must succeed on a 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the froghemoth. If the froghemoth dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Tongue
actions.desc: The Froghemoth targets one Medium or smaller creature that it can see within 20 feet of it. The target must make a 18 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the froghemoth, and the froghemoth can make a bite attack against it as a bonus action.

traits.name: Extra Heads
traits.desc: The giant has a {@chance 25|25 percent} chance of having more than one head. If it has more than one, it has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The giant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the giant takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The giant dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Vaprak's Rage (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc:
As a bonus action, the giant can enter a rage at the start of its turn. The rage lasts for 1 minute or until the giant is incapacitated. While raging, the giant gains the following benefits:
- The giant has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws
- When it makes a melee weapon attack, the giant gains a +4 bonus to the damage roll.
- The giant has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes two attacks with its greataxe.

actions.name: Greataxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 26 (3d12 + 7) slashing damage, or 30 (3d12 + 11) slashing damage while raging.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +11 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Stunning Gaze
traits.desc: When a creature that can see the gauth's central eye starts its turn within 30 feet of the gauth, the gauth can force it to make a 14 Wisdom saving throw if the gauth isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. A creature that fails the save is stunned until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the gauth in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.desc: When the gauth dies, the magical energy within it explodes, and each creature within 10 feet of it must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 (3d8) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d8) piercing damage.

actions.name: Eye Rays
actions.desc: The gauth shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:

actions.name: 1. Devour Magic Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 14 Dexterity saving throw or have one of its magic items lose all magical properties until the start of the gauth's next turn. If the object is a charged item, it also loses 1d4 charges. Determine the affected item randomly, ignoring single-use items such as potions and scrolls.

actions.name: 2. Enervation Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must make a 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: 3. Pushing Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet directly away from the gauth and have its speed halved until the start of the gauth's next turn.

actions.name: 4. Fire Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 22 (4d10) fire damage.

actions.name: 5. Paralyzing Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: 6. Sleep Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain unconscious for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on constructs and undead.

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the gazer can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.desc: The gazer can mimic simple sounds of speech it has heard, in any language. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful 10 Wisdom (Insight) check.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage.

actions.name: Eye Rays
actions.desc: The gazer shoots two of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one or two targets it can see within 60 feet of it:

actions.name: 1. Dazing Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 12 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed until the start of the gazer's next turn. While the target is charmed in this way, its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls.

actions.name: 2. Fear Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 12 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the start of the gazer's next turn.

actions.name: 3. Frost Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 (3d6) cold damage.

actions.name: 4. Telekinetic Ray
actions.desc:
If the target is a creature that is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a 12 Strength saving throw or be moved up to 30 feet directly away from the gazer.
If the target is an object weighing 10 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, the gazer moves it up to 30 feet in any direction. The gazer can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a container.

traits.name: Fire Absorption
traits.desc: Whenever the giant strider is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to half the fire damage dealt.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Fire Burst (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The giant strider hurls a gout of flame at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire spreads around corners, and it ignites flammable objects in that area that aren't being worn or carried.

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the girallon can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The girallon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The girallon makes five attacks: one with its bite and four with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit. reach 10 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

traits.name: Rampage
traits.desc: When the gnoll reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the gnoll can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The gnoll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its shortsword.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Sudden Rush
actions.desc: Until the end of the turn, the gnoll's speed increases by 60 feet and it doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

traits.name: Rampage
traits.desc: When the gnoll reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the gnoll can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The gnoll makes two melee attacks with its spear or two ranged attacks with its longbow.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage when used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Rampage
traits.desc: When the witherling reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, it can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The witherling makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its club, or two with its club.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Club
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

reactions.name: Vengeful Strike
reactions.desc: In response to a gnoll being reduced to 0 hit points within 30 feet of the witherling, the witherling makes a melee attack.

monsters.name: Green Guard Drake
monsters.damage_resistances: poison
monsters.languages: understands Draconic but can't speak it

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The guard drake can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drake attacks twice, once with its bite and once with its tail.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The grung can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Poisonous Skin
traits.desc: Any creature that grapples the grung or otherwise comes into direct contact with the grung's skin must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature no longer in direct contact with the grung can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.desc: The grung's long jump is up to 25 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) poison damage.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The grung can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Poisonous Skin
traits.desc: Any creature that grapples the grung or otherwise comes into direct contact with the grung's skin must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature no longer in direct contact with the grung can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.desc: The grung's long jump is up to 25 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) poison damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) poison damage.

actions.name: Mesmerizing Chirr (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The grung makes a chirring noise to which grungs are immune. Each humanoid or beast that is within 15 feet of the grung and able to hear it must succeed on a 12 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the end of the grung's next turn.

monsters.name: Grung Wildling

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The grung can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Poisonous Skin
traits.desc: Any creature that grapples the grung or otherwise comes into direct contact with the grung's skin must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature no longer in direct contact with the grung can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.desc: The grung's long jump is up to 25 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) poison damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) poison damage.

spells: The grung is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following ranger spells:

spells.1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, jump

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Hobgoblin Devastator

traits.name: Arcane Advantage
traits.desc: Once per turn, the hobgoblin can deal an extra 7 (2d6) damage to a creature it hits with a damaging spell attack if that target is within 5 feet of an ally of the hobgoblin and that ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Army Arcana
traits.desc: When the hobgoblin casts a spell that causes damage or that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, it can choose itself and any number of allies to be immune to the damage caused by the spell and to succeed on the required saving throw.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

spells: The hobgoblin is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): acid splash, fire bolt, ray of frost, shocking grasp

spells.1st level (4 slots): fog cloud, magic missile, thunderwave

spells.2nd level (3 slots): gust of wind, Melf's acid arrow, scorching ray

monsters.name: Hobgoblin Iron Shadow

traits.name: Unarmored Defense
traits.desc: While the hobgoblin is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The hobgoblin makes four attacks, each of which can be an unarmed strike or a dart attack. It can also use Shadow Jaunt once, either before or after one of the attacks.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Dart
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shadow Jaunt
actions.desc: The hobgoblin magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Both the space it is leaving and its destination must be in dim light or darkness.

spells: The hobgoblin is a 2nd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): minor illusion, prestidigitation, true strike

spells.1st level (3 slots): charm person, disguise self, expeditious retreat, silent image

monsters.name: Illithilich
monsters.damage_immunities: poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, lightning, necrotic

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the illithilich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed illithilich gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.desc: The illithilich has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The illithilich has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Paralyzing Touch
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 10 (3d6) cold damage. The target must succeed on a 18 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 21 (3d10 + 5) psychic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is grappled (escape 15) and must succeed on a 20 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned until this grapple ends.

actions.name: Extract Brain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one incapacitated humanoid grappled by the lich. 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the lich kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

actions.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The illithilich magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 18 Intelligence saving throw or take 27 (5d8 + 5) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary_actions.name: Tentacles
legendary_actions.desc: The illithilich makes one attack with its tentacles.

legendary_actions.name: Extract Brain (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The illithilich uses Extract Brain.

legendary_actions.name: Mind Blast (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The illithilich recharges its Mind Blast and uses it.

legendary_actions.name: Cast Spell (Costs 1–3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The illithilich uses a spell slot to cast a 1st-, 2nd-, or 3rd-level spell that it has prepared. Doing so costs 1 legendary action per level of the spell.

spells: The illithilich's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 20). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
The illithilich is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 20, +12 to hit with spell attacks). The lich has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost

spells.1st level (4 slots): detect magic, magic missile, shield, thunderwave

spells.2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, invisibility, Melf's acid arrow, mirror image

spells.3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, counterspell, dispel magic, fireball

monsters.name: Illusionist

traits.name: Displacement (Recharges after the Illusionist Casts an Illusion Spell of 1st Level or Higher)
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the illusionist projects an illusion that makes the illusionist appear to be standing in a place a few inches from its actual location, causing any creature to have disadvantage on attack rolls against the illusionist. The effect ends if the illusionist takes damage, it is incapacitated, or its speed becomes 0.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d8 - 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

spells: The illusionist is a 7th-level spellcaster. its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). The illusionist has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): dancing lights, mage hand, minor illusion, poison spray

spells.1st level (4 slots): color spray*, disguise self*, mage armor, magic missile

monsters.name: Ki-rin
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 19

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the ki-rin fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The ki-rin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The ki-rin's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The ki-rin makes three attacks: two with its hooves and one with its horn.

actions.name: Hoof
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 10 (2d4 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Horn
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.desc: The ki-rin makes a Wisdom (Perception) check or a Wisdom (Insight) check.

legendary_actions.name: Smite
legendary_actions.desc: The ki-rin makes a hoof attack or casts sacred flame.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: The ki-rin moves up to its half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

spells: The ki-rin's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 17). The ki-rin can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: gaseous form, major image (6th-level version), wind walk

spells: The ki-rin is a 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): light, mending, sacred flame, spare the dying, thaumaturgy

spells.1st level (4 slots): command, cure wounds, detect evil and good, protection from evil and good, sanctuary

spells.4th level (3 slots): banishment, freedom of movement, guardian of faith

spells.5th level (3 slots): greater restoration, mass cure wounds, scrying

traits.name: Dragon's Resistance
traits.desc: The kobold has resistance to a type of damage based on the color of dragon that invested it with power (choose or roll a d10): 1–2, acid (black); 3–4, cold (white); 5–6, fire (red); 7–8, lightning (blue); 9–10, poison (green).

traits.name: Heart of the Dragon
traits.desc: If the kobold is frightened or paralyzed by an effect that allows a saving throw, it can repeat the save at the start of its turn to end the effect on itself and all kobolds within 30 feet of it. Any kobold that benefits from this trait (including the dragonshield) has advantage on its next attack roll.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The kobold makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Sling
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Weapon Invention
actions.desc: The kobold uses one of the following options (roll a d8 or choose one); the kobold can use each one no more than once per day:

actions.name: 1. Acid
actions.desc: The kobold hurls a flask of Acid (vial)|phb|acid. Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 5/20 ft., one target. 7 (2d6) acid damage.

actions.name: 2. Alchemist's fire
actions.desc: The kobold throws a flask of Alchemist's Fire (flask)|phb|alchemist's fire. Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 5/20 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) fire damage at the start of each of the target's turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a 10 Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

actions.name: 3. Basket of Centipedes
actions.desc: The kobold throws a small basket into a 5-foot-square space within 20 feet of it. A swarm of centipedes||swarm of insects (centipedes) with 11 hit points emerges from the basket and rolls initiative.
